added_lines: def test_create_with_tags(self): t = template_format.parse(neutron_port_template) t['resources']['port']['properties']['tags'] = ['tag1', 'tag2'] stack = utils.parse_stack(t) port_prop = { 'network_id': u'net_or_sub', 'fixed_ips': [ {'subnet_id': u'net_or_sub', 'ip_address': u'10.0.3.21'} ], 'name': utils.PhysName(stack.name, 'port'), 'admin_state_up': True, 'device_owner': u'network:dhcp'} set_tag_mock = self.patchobject(neutronclient.Client, 'replace_tag') self._mock_create_with_props() port = stack['port'] scheduler.TaskRunner(port.create)() self.assertEqual((port.CREATE, port.COMPLETE), port.state) self.create_mock.assert_called_once_with({'port': port_prop}) set_tag_mock.assert_called_with('ports', port.resource_id, {'tags': ['tag1', 'tag2']}) set_tag_mock = self.patchobject(neutronclient.Client, 'replace_tag') update_props['tags'] = ['test_tag'] tags = update_dict.pop('tags') set_tag_mock.assert_called_with('ports', port.resource_id, {'tags': ['test_tag']})

subject: Fix client `retries` default value.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-20 11:14:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/a86623633018970d8607c9a883b1a386bdff9759', 'message': 'Fix client `retries` default value.

In case of constructing Client with session without specifying `retries`
value, `cinderclient.client.Client.retries` value become to None,
instead of 0. This raises TypeError on python 3 during comparison

commit_message:
Fix client `retries` default value.

In case of constructing Client with session without specifying `retries`
value, `cinderclient.client.Client.retries` value become to None,
instead of 0. This raises TypeError on python 3 during comparison
`attempts > self.retries` on
`cinderclient.client.SessionClient._cs_request`

Closes-Bug: #1684787
Change-Id: If1ac36acb0d1c92e9779e3e8995606c9b34f2cde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/55/458455/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.retries = kwargs.pop('retries', 0) or 0

commit_message:
Sync environment_config.yaml for plugins < 3.0.0

By a mistake environment_config.yaml and tasks.yaml are not synced into
db for plugins with package version lower than 3.0.0

Change-Id: If0af10c1ccfa6696cbedd27df8357bc3cb642aa8
Closes-bug: #1587134

commit_message:
Allow nfs, rpcbind and mountd service on server firewall

In order to slove the problem of running `vagrant up` hangs on
NFS mounting, we can allow these services on server firewall.

Change-Id: I70fb072b6103fa662fcfaaafd0f8f57e45193798
Closes-Bug: #1675378
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/10/451210/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: After restart NFS server we should enable and start two services:: sudo systemctl start rpcbind.service sudo systemctl start mountd.service And also allow these services on server firewall:: firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=nfs firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=rpcbind firewall-cmd --permanent --add-service=mountd firewall-cmd --reload

commit_message:
Add missing version conversion logic in request objects

This adds back logics that were missing when 'health_check' was added to
scale_in, scale_out and resize operation requests.

Change-Id: I2af5d76311587b10af216b71b8662dd4eb723ff9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/04/462004/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

service for OpenStack[2] since the kilo release.

commit_message:
Cinder volume revert to snapshot

It makes sense to be able to revert a volume to a previously taken
snapshot.

blueprint: revert-volume-to-snapshot
Change-Id: I88a1bd60e703bf9b434924acee7bbd74f72b1c2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/40/316540/27 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================== Cinder volume rollback snapshot =============================== It makes sense to be able to rollback a volume to a previously taken snapshot. The rollback function can be used to rollback a volume to a previous snapshot, restoring the volume to the state at the time the snapshot was taken. The function supports rollback to any previously taken snapshot on the volume (we will call it the rollback snapshot in this document to distinguish it from other snapshots). The rollback process will overwrite the existing volume with data from the rollback snapshot. Note: The volume that for the rollback must be detached if it is attached to a Nova instance. Problem description =================== The purpose of this feature is to make user to recover instance more conveniently. User can recover instance by rollback snapshot to the volume through the asigned snapshot. But why we need to use rollback snapshot to volume function? For the current function in cinder may not satisfied the end user's requirements. Currently if we want to recovery a instance, we have the following ways: The actual user workflow is: 1. User creates a volume(s) 2. User attach volume to instance 3. User creates a snapshot 4. Something happens causing the need of a rollback 5. User creates a volume(s) from the snapshot(s) 6. User detach old volumes 7. User attach new volumes * Use create volume from snapshot, most of vendors that this function need to copy data to the new volume, It need to spend more time to copy the datas. But the end user hope that the instance can recover quickly. * Use create volume from snapshot, the new volume could not keep the same UUID in the system, but several application use that to boot. If use rollback snapshot, it will keeping the same volume id(and therefore disk UUID) makes reverting a instance much easier since device names inside the instance stay the same. * Use restore backup, restore backup data to volume may be a way recover data when the storage is not exist, but most time the instance can't work may be not the sotrage's problem, the problem may only some data not concurrency with the systems. So we also hope that the data can recover from local, not the remote devices. If we use restore backup, we may also find it may spend more time to copy the data to the new volume. As mentioned above, we hope that can offer a way to recover instance quickly use an easiest way, rollback snapshot may be a good choice. Use Cases ========= This is intended to be a DR function. The primary use case is for a instance falldown but the storage is also live, so roolback snapshot to the volume main user case. 1. User creates a volume(s) 2. User attach volume to instance 3. User creates a snapshot 4. Something happens causing the need of a rollback 5. User dettach volume from instance 6. User rollback snapshot(s) Proposed change =============== By supporting rollback snapshot, we need to do the following changes. * Add rollback snapshot API. :: cinder rollback <volume> <snapshot> Rollback snapshot would check whether the snapshot's parent volume exists in cinder. If not, it would raise an exception.NotFound. If the snapshot doesn't exist in volume backend or the volume doesn't have related snapshot, it would raise exception.RollbackSnapshotInvalidReference. If the size of a volume not match with snapshot size, it would raise exception.RollbackSnapshotInvalidReference. During a snapashot restoration, there are two objects that are affected whose states must be reflected. The volume's status is rollbacking, the snapshot's status is also rollbacking. Other operations must not be allowed to either object during the restoration. The rollback process will overwrite the existing volume with data from the rollback snapshot; After the completion of the rollback, driver return a flag(delete_snapshot) to decide whether all other snapshots taken after the rollback snapshot will not be deleted. For lvm driver, if rollback snapshot fail, the volume's status is rollback_error. If volume is in use, it will raise an VolumeIsBusy exception to volume manager, the volume's status is still available, because the original volume data has not been changed at this time. * Add rollback_snapshot in volume driver and implement this interface in LVM driver. Alternatives ------------ create volume from snapshot Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Add a new roolback API to rollback a volume to a previous snapshot. Both "volume_id" and "snapshot_id" has to be provided for the rollback API. * Rollback snapshot * /v2/​{tenant_id}​/volumes/​{volume_id}​/rollback * Method: POST * JSON schema definition for V3:: { "rollback": { "display_name": "nightly001", "display_description": "volume_id": "xxxxxxxx", "snapshot_id": "xxxxxxxx", ...... } } Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- Driver maintainers can add the new calls to bring this functionality to their drivers. Implementation ============== I propose that rollback_snapshot be added as a new GET action on the os-volume-manage Cinder extension. It would be separately specifiable in Cinder's policy.json file to restrict access appropriately (default being admin_api). Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: chenozongliang zhongjun Work Items ---------- - Create APIs - Create RPC calls - Create driver interface - Implement LVM reference - Implement tempest test Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Standard unit tests and manual testing, as well as tempest test for these proposed APIs. Documentation Impact ==================== The new APIs will be documented. References ========== None

commit_message:
Code review changes for sysctl and Firefox comments

Change-Id: I060fb524f3b4c4253833fdd5b37055e01787aa44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-kubernetes refs/changes/49/460749/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Kubernetes. This is referred to as the `watch terminal` in this documentation:: watch -d kubectl get pods --all-namespaces .. note:: Alternatively run this which will provide more information including pod ip addresses, but needs a wider terminal as a result: watch -d kubectl get pods --all-namespaces -o wide IP address ranges, they may be changed. Simply substitute anywhere these addressesInstall Kubernetes 1.6.1 or later and other dependencies::Write the kubernetes repository file::Install Kubernetes 1.6.1 or later and other dependencies::Reload the hand-modified service files::Stop kubelet if it is running::Enable and start docker and kubelet::.. note:: If the following issue occurs after running this command: `preflight] Some fatal errors occurred: /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-iptables contents are not set to 1` There are two work-arounds: 1. Add `net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables = 1` and `net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables = 1` to ``/etc/sysctl.conf`` 2. Run with `--skip-preflight-checks` The former will require you to log out and in for the change to take effect. The latter runs the risk of missing other issues that may be flagged. Until this step is done, the `watch terminal` will not return information.Finally untaint the node (mark the master node as schedulable) so that PODs can be scheduled to this AIO deployment:: properly. In your `watch terminal`, confirm that Kubernetes has completed initialization by observing that the dns pod is in `3/3 Running` state. If you fail to wait, Step 2 will fail. .. note:: In your `watch terminal` wait for the tiller pod to successfully come up. sudo yum install -y epel-release ansible python-pip python-develModify Kolla ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml`` configuration file:: 1. Set `network_interface` in `/etc/kolla/globals.yml` to the Management interface name. E.g: `eth0`. 2. Set `neutron_external_interface` in `/etc/kolla/globals.yml` to the Neutron interface name. E.g: `eth1`. This is the external interface that Neutron will use. It must not have an IP address assigned to it. Add required configuration to the end of ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml``::Create a local cloud.yml file for the deployment of the charts:: cat <<EOF > cloud.yml EOF .. warning:: This file is populated with several values that will need to be customized to your environment, this is explained below. setting the `variable global.kolla.nova.all.placement_api_enabled` to `false` The next operations are not a simple copy and paste as the rest of this document is structured. In `/etc/kolla/globals.yml` you assigned your Management interface name to `network_interface` (E.g. `eth0`) - we will refer to this as: `YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`. Record the ip address assigned to `YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML` (E.g. `10.240.43.81`). We will refer to this as: `YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_ADDRESS_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`. Also record the name of the `neutron_external_interface` from `/etc/kolla/globals.yml` (E.g. `eth1`). We will refer to this as: `YOUR_NEUTRON_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`. Replace all occurrences of `192.168.7.105` with `YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_ADDRESS_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`:: sed -i "s@192.168.7.105@YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_ADDRESS_FROM_GLOBALS.YML@g" ./cloud.yaml This operation will have changed the values set in: `external_vip`, `dns_name` and `cinder-volumes` variables. Replace `enp1s0f1` with `YOUR_NEUTRON_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`:: sed -i "s@enp1s0f1@YOUR_NEUTRON_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML@g" ./cloud.yaml .. note:: This operation will have changed the value set in: `ext_interface_name` variable. Replace `docker0` with the management interface name (E.g. `eth0`) used for connectivity between nodes in kubernetes cluster, in most cases it is `YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML`:: sed -i "s@docker0@YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_NAME_FROM_GLOBALS.YML@g" ./cloud.yaml .. note:: This operation will have changed the value set in: `tunnel_interface` variable.with the devices ``/dev/sdb`` and ``/dev/sdc``::system::chart to avoid the iscsd container from going into crash loops::Execute the cinder-volume-lvm Helm chart::In the `watch terminal` wait for all pods to enter into Running state. If you didn't run watch in a different terminal, you can run it now:: watch -d kubectl get pods --all-namespaces they use a lot. This is by no means a comprehensive guide to Using OpenStack =============== If you were able to successfully reach the end of this guide and `demo1` was successfully deployed, here is a fun list of things you can do with your new cluster. Access Horizon GUI ------------------ 1. Determine Horizon IP Address:: $ kubectl get pods --all-namespaces -o wide | grep horizon | awk '{ print $7 }' 10.1.49.37 2. Determine username and password from keystone:: $ cat ~/keystonerc_admin | grep OS_USERNAME export OS_USERNAME=admin $ cat ~/keystonerc_admin | grep OS_PASSWORD export OS_PASSWORD=Sr6XMFXvbvxQCJ3Cib1xb0gZ3lOtBOD8FCxOcodU 3. Install a brower, E.g. firefox on the host running kolla-kubernetes 4. Run the browser, and access Horizon GUI with the IP from Step 1, using the credentials from Step 2.
deleted_lines: Kubernetes and also shows the PODs IP addresses:: watch -d kubectl get pods --all-namespaces IP address ranges, they may be changed. Simply subtitute anywhere these addressesInstall Kubernetes 1.6.1 or later::write the kubernetes repository file::Install Kubernetes 1.6.1 or later::Then reload the hand-modified service files::Then stop kubelet if it is running::Then enable and start docker and kubelet:: Until this step is done, the 'watch -d kubectl get pods --all-namespaces' command will not return information.Finally untaint the node so that PODs can be scheduled to this AIO deployment:: properly. You will know kubernetes has completed initialization by checking using below command: $ kubectl get pods --all-namespaces | grep dns dns should be in 3/3 Running. If you fail to wait, Step 2 will fail. watch "kubectl get pods -n kube-system | grep tiller" sudo yum install -y epel-release sudo yum install -y ansible python-pip python-develModify Kolla configuration:: - set network_interface in /etc/kolla/globals.yml to the management interface name. - set neutron_external_interface in /etc/kolla/globals.yml to the Neutron interface name. This is the external interface that neutron will use. It must not have an IP address assigned to it. Add required configuration to the end of /etc/kolla/globals.yml::Create a local cloud.yaml file for the deployment of the charts:: setting the variable global.kolla.nova.all.placement_api_enabled to false The next operation is not a simple copy and paste as the rest of this document is structured. You should determine your management interface which is the value of 'network_interface' in ``/etc/kolla/globals.yml`` e.g. 'eth0' and replace the contents of YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_FROM_GLOBALS.YML in the following sed operation, using the ip address assigned to that network interface. Replace all occurrences of 192.168.7.105 with your management interface ip (e.g. 10.240.43.81):: sed -i "s@192.168.7.105@YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_FROM_GLOBALS.YML@g" ./cloud.yaml Replace all occurrences of enp1s0f1 with your neutron interface name (e.g. eth1):: sed -i "s@enp1s0f1@YOUR_NEUTRON_NETWORK_INTERFACE_FROM_GLOBALS.YML@g" ./cloud.yaml Some of the variables in the cloud.yaml file that may need to be customized are: - set ``external_vip`` to the IP address of your management interface (sed operation above takes care of this) - set ``dns_name`` to the IP address of your management network (sed operation above takes care of this) - set ``tunnel_interface`` to the IP address of your management interface interface name used for connectivity between nodes in kubernetes cluster, in most of cases it matches the name of the kubernetes host management interface. To determine this, ``grep network_interface /etc/kolla/globals.yml``. Note that this is the same address as YOUR_NETWORK_INTERFACE_FROM_GLOBALS.YML -from above - set ``ext_interface_name`` to the interface name used for your neutron interface name (e.g. eth1)with the devices ``/dev/sdb`` and ``/dev/sdc``: ::system. ::chart to avoid the iscsd container from going into crash loops: ::Execute the cinder-volume-lvm Helm chart: ::Observe the previously running watch command in a different terminal. Wait for all pods to enter into Running state. If you didn't run watch in a different terminal, you can run it now:: watch -d -n 5 -c kubectl get pods --all-namespaces they use a lot. This is but no means a comprehensive guide to

commit_message:
Fix OVS-related issues with underlay networking

* more intelligent calculation of default port provider
* additional check of patchcord existing in the bridge

OVS provider should be used for fake (OVS) ports, inserted
into OVS bridge. OVS provider should be used for inserting
native linux interface into OVS bridge.

But if we try to add native linux subinterface into
OVS bridge we should use lnx provider for creating
such port correctly.

Change-Id: Ib76b3340eca1ea22095da1cfffe7c224a139fb71
Closes-bug: #1682835

commit_message:
Rename misleading undercloud/overcloud hieradata overrides

There was a misconception and thus it ended up in a misleading name for
the hieradata overrides set up by quickstart. Thus, the hieradata
overrides that were there before ended up being called the "overcloud"
hieradata, even though it's not used in the overcloud at all. In
reality, it was being used by the classic undercloud install and is used
to configure extra bits from the undercloud OpenStack deployment.

Thus I changed the names to reflect the actual meaning of these files.

Change-Id: I6504f03706c81becea5c38b03ef619a5613c544c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/01/458501/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # thus requiring a t-h-t driven undercloud *and* the classic undercloud # override file hieradata_override_file_classic_undercloud: hieradata-overrides-classic-undercloud.yaml.j2 hieradata_override_file_t_h_t_undercloud: hieradata-overrides-t-h-t-undercloud.yaml.j2
deleted_lines: # thus requiring an undercloud *and* overcloud override file hieradata_override_file_overcloud: hieradata-overrides-overcloud.yaml.j2 hieradata_override_file_undercloud: hieradata-overrides-undercloud.yaml.j2

commit_message:
Fix race condition for primary component bootstrap

Create node is_pc flag before starting to check if there
is more than one of those flags. Thus, we avoid race condition
when there is 0 is_pc flags and galera starts with --wsrep-new-cluster
on 2 nodes.

We set it before the check and, as setting them is synchronous through
Pacemaker CIB, in that case when >1 nodes attempt to bootstrap with
--wsrep-new-cluster, only one node will see <= 1 is_pc flags. Others
will see more than one and fail and reattempt to start. At that point
one of the nodes will already be bootstrapped, thus reelection will not
be triggered and the section of bootstrap will be skipped

Change-Id: I82a71132eef7877ac7ab1ed04263044b3b1e8d9b
Closes-bug: #1617400
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Support a "mirror" method of apt-get

apt-get supports a "mirror" method that will automatically select a
closest mirror based on geographical location. So extend URI library
to handle repository sources with mirror://

Change-Id: I7b8018af50e431614d0d5c87ad3f1c8bad94e4d9
Closes-Bug: #1669751

commit_message:
Fix OVS-related issues with underlay networking

* more intelligent calculation of default port provider
* additional check of patchcord existing in the bridge

OVS provider should be used for fake (OVS) ports, inserted
into OVS bridge. OVS provider should be used for inserting
native linux interface into OVS bridge.

But if we try to add native linux subinterface into
OVS bridge we should use lnx provider for creating
such port correctly.

Change-Id: Ib76b3340eca1ea22095da1cfffe7c224a139fb71
Closes-bug: #1682835

commit_message:
Skip extend with snapshot until bug 1687048 is fixed

Several Cinder CIs fail on the test
test_volume_extend_when_volume_has_snapshot due to
driver limitations. A fix for this is in preparation.
Until then this test should be skipped to allow the
drivers 3rd party CIs to provide useful testing.

Change-Id: Ifed8741cd622411a0265bf6416a4628f40bea068
Partial-bug: #1687048

commit_message:
Remove the tempest layer4 job

The last of the layer4 service tests (for heat) are being removed from
tempest. However, this job is blocking that from happening because tests
have to run for the job to pass. This commit removes the job since
it's not doing anything anymore.

Change-Id: I983de842f1bf84a939cbcda6c65185c694a69949
Needed-By: Ifc2cac575919da4e361eaa3234d7e0f3e2f98d21

commit_message:
Add a button to create audit template in audit creat form

This commit provides a method to create audit template when
creating an audit but found there is no suitable template or
even no template at all.

Change-Id: I339e95671857a64ea49c4a5736bc6ab6a00d84e8

commit_message:
Fixing Tox and optimize the link address

Now gate job for Python 3.5 exists and not 3.4,
we should remove those references to the 3.4 that is untested and

Use https instead of http to ensure the safety.

Running py2* post py3* tests results in error. Add
'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv to
resolve this.

Change-Id: I6253c1e786dab027e568a4afd75f1c77aa4977e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-dashboard refs/changes/63/459563/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv

Running py2* post py3* tests results in error. Add
'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv to
resolve this.

Change-Id: Ie704b12c413c9e8cc0b2649c1d2bbc03a3b61a11

commit_message:
Replace neutronclient with REST API calls in quotas commands

All quotas related commands to Neutron like
list/create/update/delete
are now made via keystoneauth

Change-Id: I5f0cb3e174c2f5453d2fe760bb39b2140fe1f201

commit_message:
Move REST error_messages to error_message argument

The with shade_exceptions is not doing what is expected here - since it
passes OpenStackCloudException objects on unmodified. Instead, use the
new error_message parameter to continue to give friendly error messages.

Also - wow, we were mocking _compute_client for the nova extensions
tests. I believe that was become those pre-dated our use of
requests_mock. Anyway, that's super lame (and also broke because of this
patch), so it's now fixed.

Change-Id: Ia764cc76d724a8a732fa2b1209a138634a25a9e1

commit_message:
Reduce init restart/kill times

The systemd unit 'TimeoutSec' value which controls the time
between sending a SIGTERM signal and a SIGKILL signal when
stopping or restarting the service has been reduced from 300
seconds to 120 seconds. This provides 2 minutes for long-lived
sessions to drain while preventing new ones from starting
before a restart or a stop.

The 'RestartSec' value which controls the time between the
service stop and start when restarting has been reduced from
150 seconds to 2 seconds to make the restart happen faster.

These values can be adjusted by using the *_init_config_overrides
variables which use the config_template task to change template
defaults.

Change-Id: Ia10703ca1cfa5afd1dec09a52f1b981711796e33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cloudkitty refs/changes/44/460044/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Timeout (in seconds) for cinder to wait between SIGTERM and SIGKILL # Applies to TimeoutSec in systemd, affecting start and stop times. # 'sigkill_timeout' is a global option should one desired. cloudkitty_sigkill_timeout: 120 # Number of seconds to wait before restarting the service cloudkitty_restart_wait: 5

commit_message:
Glance: make PV flexible

This PS makes the PV used for the file backend flexible, allowing
operators to specify the annotation and size used/allocated.

Change-Id: I6d153143f9cc268c4c543e392ddf115e5db67a57

commit_message:
Add 'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv

Running py2* post py3* tests results in error. Add
'rm -f .testrepository/times.dbm' command in testenv to
resolve this.

Change-Id: Ia43f8d10f157d988c4d2c89f16cac0ea729cabe6

commit_message:
replace nova endpoint

The default is publicURL in novaclient.
This also caused the failure of
gate-watcher-dsvm-multinode-ubuntu-xenial-nv.

Change-Id: I485dd62fb7199ffeca29a9b573a624bf144484d1
Closes-Bug: #1686298
Closes-Bug: #1686281

commit_message:
Release python-openstacklient 3.10.0

A patch between 3.9.0 has a fix where get_one_cloud is only called with
validate=True for auth_required=True commands.

Without this patch [1], deploying os-client-config 1.27.0 will fail to
call keystoneauth library.

[1] 1c3cb0a3b54cdb6cd5b27e88372b65cfac844422

Related-Bug: #1687706

Change-Id: I482ead44d81c5d2ff32c2c23447440edac67a5ad

commit_message:
Bump keystoneauth1 to 2.20.0

Release 2.20.0 includes changes to support loading an Adapter from the
conf [1].  The new APIs are required by nova change set [2] for the
referenced blueprint use-service-catalog-for-endpoints; hence the
minimum version bump.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/460337
[2] https://review.openstack.org/458257

Change-Id: I6d03b6f7ff65494856c7f2d5a54e20b0c3796df0
Related: Blueprint use-service-catalog-for-endpoints

commit_message:
Add direction field to QoS bandwidth limit.

This patch enables the direction ('ingress'/'egress') field
on the QoS bandwidth limit rule object and CRUD commands.

Closes-Bug: 1614121
Depends-On: Ia13568879c2b6f80fb190ccafe7e19ca05b0c6a8
Change-Id: I90c412a5c8757b3ffe8abfc1165a70bdb8744702

commit_message:
Don't get ports info from unavailable neutron service

In shade.meta._get_supplemental_addresses() Neutron API was
called to get ports list even if cloud.has_service('neutron')
returned False.
Now it's done only if Neutron service is available.

Change-Id: I30ff7a8d049ef0bac025ac21185deb50760144cf
Closes-Bug: https://storyboard.openstack.org/?#!/story/2001011

subject: Replace retrying with tenacity
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-30 19:49:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/fe5047450e4f225215aa70bf04fb751c7efb214c', 'message': "Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Change-Id: I051dbcd9cffba1a5880ff7a99a19ba652b1fcebc
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-06 18:30:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/8f1b0f3fa77fc668a4d8689aa4d55bf9bd6cc606', 'message': "Replace retrying with tenacity

'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Change-Id: I051dbcd9cffba1a5880ff7a99a19ba652b1fcebc
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-06 18:33:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/4568420fa78356d3acd1bf5914d1905ac77e60fe', 'message': "Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

commit_message:
Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Closes-Bug: #1635393

Change-Id: I051dbcd9cffba1a5880ff7a99a19ba652b1fcebc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/52/380552/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import tenacity """A wrapper around tenacity library. def _backoff_sleep(previous_attempt_number, delay_since_first_attempt_sec): wait_val = random.randrange(interval, wait_for) else: wait_val = wait_for LOG.debug("Sleeping for %s seconds.", wait_val) def _print_stop(previous_attempt_number, delay_since_first_attempt_sec): delay_since_first_attempt_sec) r = tenacity.Retrying( retry=tenacity.retry_if_exception_type(exception), wait=_backoff_sleep, stop=_print_stop, reraise=True)
deleted_lines: import retrying """A wrapper around retrying library. def _retry_on_exception(e): return isinstance(e, exception) def _backoff_sleep(previous_attempt_number, delay_since_first_attempt_ms): wait_val = random.randrange(interval * 1000.0, wait_for * 1000.0) else: wait_val = wait_for * 1000.0 LOG.debug("Sleeping for %s seconds.", (wait_val / 1000.0)) def _print_stop(previous_attempt_number, delay_since_first_attempt_ms): delay_since_first_attempt = delay_since_first_attempt_ms / 1000.0 delay_since_first_attempt) r = retrying.Retrying(retry_on_exception=_retry_on_exception, wait_func=_backoff_sleep, stop_func=_print_stop)

commit_message:
Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added/removed where applicable.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Closes-Bug: #1635387

Change-Id: I0b5a893c652f3e1649a273c300119d00db532cc5

commit_message:
[upstream] fix missing line and describe voting/non-voting

While reviewing the content today I noticed that it appears
that I cannot have an image and text on a slide.  I created
a new slide and moved the line.  I also got feedback while
running through this deck that we should add a description of
voting and non-voting jobs.  So, that content is also added.

Change-Id: I7dfce3c5600c995114ae54946fd27e3a5258d6a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/29/461929/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Analysing Jenkins Failures ========================== - Directs the user to saved log output - Navigate via browser to view the logs - Voting and non-voting jobs - Voting job failures cause a -1 vote from Jenkins on the patch - Non-voting jobs do not cause a -1 vote from Jenkins upon failure - Non-voting jobs are new jobs that are being tested and may not yet be ready to vote

added_lines: - [N311] importing code from other virt drivers is forbidden- [N312] using config vars from other virt drivers is forbidden- [N314] vim configuration should not be kept in source files - [N316] assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) cannot be used assertIsInstance(A, B) should be used instead - [N317] assertEqual(type(A), B) cannot be used assertIsInstance(A, B) should be used instead - [N318] assertEqual(A, None) and assertEqual(None, A) cannot be used assertIsNone(A) should be used instead - [N319] debug level logs should not be translated - [N320] Setting CONF.* attributes directly in tests is forbidden Use self.flags(option=value) instead - [N321] all LOG messages, except debug ones, must have translations - [N322] method's default argument must not be mutable - [N323] the _() function must be explicitly imported This ensure proper translations - [N324] json.%(fun)s cannot be used jsonutils.%(fun)s should be used instead - [N325] str() and unicode() cannot be used on an exception Remove use or use six.text_type() - [N326] Translated messages cannot be concatenated String should be included in translated message - [N328] LOG.info messages must use _LI - [N329] LOG.exception messages must use _LE - [N330] LOG.warning and LOG.warn messages must use _LW - [N332] the api_version decorator must be the first decorator on a method - [N334] assertTrue/False(A in/not in B, message) must not be used assertIn/NotIn(A, B, message) should be used instead- [N336] a dict constructor with a sequence of key-value pairs must not be used dict comprehension should be used instead - [N337] translations must not be imported in tests - [N338] assertEqual(A in B, True) and assertEqual(True, A in B), assertEqual(A in B, False) or assertEqual(False, A in B) must not be used assertIn/NotIn(A, B) should be used instead - [N339] common raise_feature_not_supported() must be used for v2.1 HTTPNotImplemented response - [N340] greenthread.spawn() and eventlet.spawn() must not be used Use nova.utils.spawn() instead - [N341] contextlib.nested is deprecated and must not be used - [N342] config options must be in the central location ``nova/conf/`` - [N343] check for common double word typos - [N344] Python 3: do not use dict.iteritems - [N345] Python 3: do not use dict.iterkeys - [N346] Python 3: do not use dict.itervalues - [N348] os.popen() is deprecated and must not be used - [N349] check for closures in tests which are not used - [N350] policy registration must be in the central location ``nova/policies/`` - [N351] oslo_policy.policy.Enforcer.enforce() method must not be used - [N352] LOG.warn is deprecated and must not be used LOG.warning should be used instead - [N353] assertIs(A, None) and assertIs(None, A) must not be used assertIsNone(A) should be used instead - [N354] assertIsNot(A, None) and assertIsNot(None, A) must not be used assertIsNotNone(A) should be used instead
deleted_lines: - [N311] importing code from other virt drivers forbidden- [N312] using config vars from other virt drivers forbidden- [N314] vim configuration should not be kept in source files. - [N316] Change assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) by optimal assert like assertIsInstance(A, B). - [N317] Change assertEqual(type(A), B) by optimal assert like assertIsInstance(A, B) - [N318] Change assertEqual(A, None) or assertEqual(None, A) by optimal assert like assertIsNone(A) - [N319] Validate that debug level logs are not translated. - [N320] Setting CONF.* attributes directly in tests is forbidden. Use self.flags(option=value) instead. - [N321] Validate that LOG messages, except debug ones, have translations - [N322] Method's default argument shouldn't be mutable - [N323] Ensure that the _() function is explicitly imported to ensure proper translations. - [N324] Ensure that jsonutils.%(fun)s must be used instead of json.%(fun)s - [N325] str() and unicode() cannot be used on an exception. Remove use or use six.text_type() - [N326] Translated messages cannot be concatenated. String should be included in translated message. - [N328] Validate that LOG.info messages use _LI. - [N329] Validate that LOG.exception messages use _LE. - [N330] Validate that LOG.warning and LOG.warn messages use _LW. - [N332] Check that the api_version decorator is the first decorator on a method - [N334] Change assertTrue/False(A in/not in B, message) to the more specific assertIn/NotIn(A, B, message)- [N336] Must use a dict comprehension instead of a dict constructor with a sequence of key-value pairs. - [N337] Don't import translation in tests - [N338] Change assertEqual(A in B, True), assertEqual(True, A in B), assertEqual(A in B, False) or assertEqual(False, A in B) to the more specific assertIn/NotIn(A, B) - [N339] Check common raise_feature_not_supported() is used for v2.1 HTTPNotImplemented response. - [N340] Check nova.utils.spawn() is used instead of greenthread.spawn() and eventlet.spawn() - [N341] contextlib.nested is deprecated - [N342] Config options should be in the central location ``nova/conf/`` - [N343] Check for common double word typos - [N344] Python 3: do not use dict.iteritems. - [N345] Python 3: do not use dict.iterkeys. - [N346] Python 3: do not use dict.itervalues. - [N348] Deprecated library function os.popen() - [N349] Check for closures in tests which are not used - [N350] Policy registration should be in the central location ``nova/policies/`` - [N351] Do not use the oslo_policy.policy.Enforcer.enforce() method. - [N352] LOG.warn is deprecated. Enforce use of LOG.warning. - [N353] Change assertIs(A, None) or assertIs(None, A) to assertIsNone(A) - [N354] Change assertIsNot(A, None) or assertIsNot(None, A) to assertIsNotNone(A)

Move containers common volumes from yaql to list_concat

list_concat was introduced recently and is able to replace the yaql
calls for concatenating lists.

The run_process function in devstack is intended for things that
aren't already daemonizing properly, that have some foreground to work
with, potentially putting output onto the console. It was not intended
for services that already have init systems.

commit_message:
don't use run_process for odl

The run_process function in devstack is intended for things that
aren't already daemonizing properly, that have some foreground to work
with, potentially putting output onto the console. It was not intended
for services that already have init systems.

Don't use it for odl. It has a start/stop system already, which is
sufficient.

Change-Id: I0ad88d3ab0eb11c17f9b1140a2e4318990c946a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/89/461889/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # this is a forking process, just start it in the background $ODL_DIR/$ODL_NAME/bin/start

commit_message:
Use LogRecord.msg instead of LogRecord.message in tests

From the docs for LogRecord.message [1],

> This is set when Formatter.format() is invoked.

Apparently we may find ourselves in a situation [2] where that never
happens? Really weird that it failed *midway* through the test though;
maybe some concurrent test removed all formatters?

ERROR: test_known_bad_ec_config
(test.unit.common.test_storage_policy.TestStoragePolicies)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File ".../mock/mock.py", line 1305, in patched
    return func(*args, **keywargs)
  File ".../test/unit/common/test_storage_policy.py", line 688, in test_known_bad_ec_config
    self.assertIn(msg, records[0].message)
AttributeError: 'LogRecord' object has no attribute 'message'

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/logging.html#logrecord-attributes

commit_message:
Use ansible from within the kolla_toolbox virtualenv

kolla-toolbox is being updated to install ansible into a virtualenv[0].
Remove the hardcoded path from ansible in tasks so that it will work
from the new location.

[0] I2129931cbddab0c95828a8723698d838f767d615

Change-Id: I421d09ae36c6d67863ae895029fda572ea8f06fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/24/435024/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: command: docker exec -t kolla_toolbox /var/lib/kolla/venv/bin/ansible localhost

subject: Reparent kolla-toolbox from openstack-base
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-16 17:07:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/ac738d363e63ca901a1cb8540c981aed65bfe417', 'message': 'Reparent kolla-toolbox from openstack-base

This patch changes the parent of kolla-toolbox from base to
openstack-base.

The benefits to this are as follows:

* Makes the openstack client utilties available in kolla_toolbox. This
  is useful for scripts looking to wrap toolbox to run client commands.

* Allows us to install the pip related packages such as ansible in a
  virtualenv. This makes kolla_toolbox more consistent with the rest
  of Kolla for python package management.

* Allows us to use macros to install the current pip packages, as well
  as making upper-constraints.txt available for further packages.

* Trims down duplicated dependencies required in kolla_toolbox

Change-Id: I2129931cbddab0c95828a8723698d838f767d615

commit_message:
Reparent kolla-toolbox from openstack-base

This patch changes the parent of kolla-toolbox from base to
openstack-base.

The benefits to this are as follows:

* Makes the openstack client utilties available in kolla_toolbox. This
  is useful for scripts looking to wrap toolbox to run client commands.

* Allows us to install the pip related packages such as ansible in a
  virtualenv. This makes kolla_toolbox more consistent with the rest
  of Kolla for python package management.

* Cleans up dependencies

Closes-Bug: #1644746
Closes-Bug: #1545448

Depends-On: I421d09ae36c6d67863ae895029fda572ea8f06fa
Change-Id: I2129931cbddab0c95828a8723698d838f767d615
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/23/435023/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FROM {{ namespace }}/{{ image_prefix }}openstack-base:{{ tag }}# NOTE(pbourke): enable the virtualenv regardless of source/binary so ansible # can be used consistently from the playbooks ENV PATH /var/lib/kolla/venv/bin:$PATH {% set kolla_toolbox_base_packages = [ 'pytz', 'ansible==2.1.1.0', 'MySQL-python', 'os-client-config==1.16.0', 'pyudev', 'shade==1.5.0' ] %} {{ macros.install_pip(kolla_toolbox_base_packages | customizable("pip_packages"), use_requirements=False) }} && sed -i 's| "identity_api_version": "2.0",| "identity_api_version": "3",|' \ /var/lib/kolla/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/os_client_config/defaults.json
deleted_lines: FROM {{ namespace }}/{{ image_prefix }}base:{{ tag }}{% set os_client_config='/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/os_client_config/defaults.json' %} 'MariaDB-devel', 'MariaDB-shared', 'MariaDB-client',{% if base_distro == 'debian' %} {% set os_client_config='/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/os_client_config/defaults.json' %} {% endif %} {% block kolla_toolbox_source_install_python_pip %} RUN curl https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py -o get-pip.py \ && python get-pip.py \ && rm get-pip.py {% endblock %} RUN pip --no-cache-dir install \ pytz \ ansible==2.1.1.0 \ MySQL-python \ os-client-config==1.16.0 \ pyudev \ shade==1.5.0 && sed -i 's| "identity_api_version": "2.0",| "identity_api_version": "3",|' {{ os_client_config }}

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2011 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ Scheduler host weights """ from zun.scheduler import weights class WeighedHost(weights.WeighedObject): def to_dict(self): x = dict(weight=self.weight) x['host'] = self.obj.host return x def __repr__(self): return "WeighedHost [host: %r, weight: %s]" % ( self.obj, self.weight) class BaseHostWeigher(weights.BaseWeigher): """Base class for host weights.""" pass class HostWeightHandler(weights.BaseWeightHandler): object_class = WeighedHost def __init__(self): super(HostWeightHandler, self).__init__(BaseHostWeigher) def all_weighers(): """Return a list of weight plugin classes found in this directory.""" return HostWeightHandler().get_all_classes()

commit_message:
Remove Pike priorities that cannot make it due to recent team changes

Also add backup assignees for folks who are unlikely to be able to continue
working on ironic upstream, and remove folks who resigned from the team.

Lower priority of rescue, as it's in the process of changing assignees,
and thus is at risk.

Change-Id: Ia1d4f0fbe0dd645241faa23d636adc7a61bc81eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/86/460086/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: | Python 3.5 compatibility | JayF, hurricanerix, Nisha || `Rescue mode`_ | mariojv, JayF, wanyen |
deleted_lines: | Python 3.5 compatibility | JayF, hurricanerix || `Rescue mode`_ | mariojv, JayF || `Specific fault support`_ | JayF, mariojv | +---------------------------------------+-------------------------------------+| `Documentation reorganization`_ | JayF, TheJulia | +---------------------------------------+-------------------------------------+| `Deploy steps`_ | yolanda, rloo | +---------------------------------------+-------------------------------------+| `IPA authentication`_ | jroll, joanna | +---------------------------------------+-------------------------------------+Specific fault support ---------------------- Currently we communicate certain node errors via setting maintenance mode. This is not obvious, and is a constant source of complaints from operators. This work allows us to better communicate such failures, by providing a new API for working with them. Documentation reorganization ---------------------------- For some time, our documentation has grown without strict definition of structure, as well as difficulties getting documentation into the primary OpenStack documentation. In the Pike cycle we plan on reaching a consensus of direction for our documentation structure so we can better self-service as OpenStack evolves to better support projects such as ironic. Deploy steps ------------ This is an effort to split parts of our monolithic deployment process into steps, similar to cleaning. That will give driver authors a bit more freedom in customizing the deploy process, and simplify potential additions to it (like RAID, for example). IPA authentication ------------------ Neither IPA API, nor the lookup/heartbeat endpoints it uses are currently authenticated. While this issue is hard to solve completely in generic case, we can at least consider reducing potential attack surface.

subject: Allow RPCServer to listen on many targets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 16:06:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/7e176e6c352eb8f82333cf20664c82cfd91e03f1', 'message': "Allow RPCServer to listen on many targets

The current implementation of RPCServer allows to listen only
one target per instance of this class. Each RPCServer
class requires a connection to the amqp broker with
LISTEN purporses from the сonnection_pool and create
its own executor with a thread pool (default size 64).

A connection to live as long, as run its own process. Also the
connection pool doesn't have limitation for connections of this
type, only for SEND purporses.

Many openstack project like neutron want to listen many targets.
For example, it does in the ovs neutron agent, which has 8 targets
(consumers) and for each target will be created its own RPCServer
with only one endpoint - OVSNeutronAgent. Similar situation in the
linuxbridge agent with its own 5 targets and others projects.

You can explore its rpc impl in the neutron/agent/rpc.py

Currently we have the next aproach for many openstack projects:
[*] one target -> one rcp server -> one tcp connection + executor

I think it leads to large overhead for a amqp broker if we have hundreds
of compute nodes.I don't see any real reasons for creating a dedicated
connection for each target.

So, I'm reimplement the NotificationServer approach for RPCServer and
want to use it at first for neutron rpc.

Change-Id: Ic08490a8bfb9bf46b2b7534785c75e7c71baa56c

commit_message:
Allow RPCServer to listen on many targets

The current implementation of RPCServer allows to listen only
one target per instance of this class. Each RPCServer
class requires a connection to the amqp broker with
LISTEN purporses from the сonnection_pool and create
its own executor with a thread pool (default size 64).

A connection to live as long, as run its own process. Also the
connection pool doesn't have limitation for connections of this
type, only for SEND purporses.

Many openstack projects like neutron want to listen many targets.
For example, it does in the ovs neutron agent, which has 8 targets
(consumers) and for each target will be created its own RPCServer
with only one endpoint - OVSNeutronAgent. Similar situation in the
linuxbridge agent with its own 5 targets and others projects.

You can explore its rpc impl in the neutron/agent/rpc.py

Currently we have the next aproach for many openstack projects:
[*] one target -> one rcp server -> one tcp connection + executor

I think it leads to large overhead for a amqp broker if we have hundreds
of compute nodes.I don't see any real reasons for creating a dedicated
connection for each target.

So, I'm reimplement the NotificationServer approach for RPCServer and
want to use it at first for neutron rpc.

Change-Id: Ic08490a8bfb9bf46b2b7534785c75e7c71baa56c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/29/304729/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[upstream] Refines Documentation section

- Expands from specialty team to documentation team structure
- Explains project installation tutorials and developer documentation
  which are also related with documentation activities
- Includes training-guides in bug reports
- Explains draft documentation, documentation testing activities,
  and EOL-ed documents

Change-Id: I26561626a7c2c4c2c8ab7233615dd75acc467bf1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/08/461908/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Documentation team structure ============================ - Specialty teams - API, Configuration Reference and CLI Reference, High Availability Guide, Hypervisor Tuning Guide, Installation guides, Networking Guide, Operations and Architecture Design guides, Security Guide, Tools, Training guides, Training labs, User and Administration guides - `Docs cores <https://review.openstack.org/#/admin/groups/30,members>`_ and separate core teams for `docs-specs <https://review.openstack.org/#/admin/groups/384,members>`_ , `security-doc <https://review.openstack.org/#/admin/groups/347,members>`_ , `training-guides <https://review.openstack.org/#/admin/groups/360,members>`_ , and `training-labs <https://review.openstack.org/#/admin/groups/1118,members>`_ - `Documentation cross-project liaisons <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CrossProjectLiaisons#Documentation>`_ for questions, reviews, doc bug triaging, and patching docs- `Official deliverables with repositories <https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/projects/documentation.html#deliverables>`_ - Project repos can have installation tutorial and developer documentation - Example: `Heat repository <https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat/tree/>`_ - `Installation Tutorial (Ocata) <https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/orchestration/ocata/>`_ is published from install-guide directory in stable/ocata branch - `Developer documentation <https://docs.openstack.org/developer/heat/>`_ is published from doc directory in master branch- https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-training-guides Draft documentation, testing, and EOL ===================================== - https://docs.openstack.org/draft/draft-index.html - Some documents (e.g., install-guides) require testing with releases! - EOL documents are not maintained in documentation repositories - See EOL status at: https://releases.openstack.org
deleted_lines: Specialty teams =============== - API - Configuration Reference and CLI Reference - High Availability Guide - Hypervisor Tuning Guide - Installation guides - Networking Guide - Operations and Architecture Design guides - Security Guide - Training guides - Training labs - User guides- ``docs-specs`` - ``openstack-doc-tools`` - ``openstack-manuals`` - ``openstackdocstheme`` - ``security-doc`` - ``training-guides`` - ``training-labs``

commit_message:
Fix conditional for EPEL Repo enable/disable for OSA

Because the job runs against Ubuntu and CentOS7 hosts, we need to ensure
that the task won't fail on an Ubuntu host. This patch changes to a
conditional so the exit code is 0 rather than 1 when running on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I4ab7194db9ded8190dca209f284e5195e526b695

commit_message:
Connect brbm-inspector and brbm when needed

Ensure that brbm-inspector is connected to brbm only when
IRONIC_IS_HARDWARE=False and IRONIC_BAREMETAL_BASIC_OPS=True.
Otherwise bridge brbm does not exist and stack.sh exits with
error.

Change-Id: I8c255a0140ec6b33f801d13ca10a2bb19e7469f6
Closes-Bug: #1670595

commit_message:
[config-ref] Update keystone config tables

This is not a backport as options might have changed between ocata and
pike. The tables have been generated using the autohelp script.

Change-Id: I8fc6e39ceedd06c7c9d1026179b4591600ce28f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/05/462005/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - (String) Entry point for the policy backend driver in the `keystone.policy` namespace. Supplied drivers are `rules` (which does not support any CRUD operations for the v3 policy API) and `sql`. Typically, there is no reason to set this option unless you are providing a custom entry point.
deleted_lines: - (String) Entrypoint for the policy backend driver in the keystone.policy namespace. Supplied drivers are rules and sql.

commit_message:
WIP - allow libvirt tcp migration for upgrade.

After I367757cbe8757d11943af7e41af620f9ce919a06 deployments have
enabled ssh tunnelling for libvirt authentication. We should
provide a way for deployers to allow TCP migration at least for
the duration of the upgrade.

Otherwise after running the newton..ocata compute upgrade it may
may not be possible to complete vm migration between compute nodes
without manual intervention

Depends-On: Ib7baa392d973ad69dee6e89cfb0434dc2222f4fc
Change-Id: I99dd8c579577f80dbd476d863978237d708a939d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/47/462047/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: } elsif hiera('nova::migration::libvirt::transport', '') == 'tcp' { class { '::nova::migration::libvirt': transport => 'tcp' configure_libvirt => $libvirt_enabled, configure_nova => $nova_compute_enabled, }

commit_message:
WIP: Add AllowLibvirtMigrationTCP - libvirt tcp migration for upgrade.

After I367757cbe8757d11943af7e41af620f9ce919a06 deployments have
enabled ssh tunnelling for libvirt authentication. We should
provide a way for deployers to allow TCP migration at least for
the duration of the upgrade.

Otherwise after running the newton..ocata compute upgrade it may
may not be possible to complete vm migration between compute nodes
without manual intervention

puppet-tripleo @ I99dd8c579577f80dbd476d863978237d708a939d

Change-Id: Ib7baa392d973ad69dee6e89cfb0434dc2222f4fc
Related-Bug: TODO

commit_message:
Add a event poll command

This adds a new event poll command, allowing to wait for stack
completion after actions if you omit the wait argument.

Change-Id: I1eb83596644dcf42cd369770a81686583e5aced9
Closes-Bug: #1660659

commit_message:
Change ssh/config permissions to 600

ssh/config permissions are 664 currently, causing error
`Bad owner or permissions on /home/jenkins/.ssh/config`

http://logs.openstack.org/68/461368/1/check/gate-kolla-ansible-dsvm-deploy-centos-binary-centos-7-nv/0a94da7/console.html#_2017-05-01_12_06_08_440775

config file should only be writen by owner.

Closes-Bug: #1687408
Change-Id: Id804f11a91858fa297e5236beb2110e3511eabec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/68/461368/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cat /home/jenkins/.ssh/config ls -la /home/jenkins/.ssh/

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: Ic958d3197ec58fb21dd4172a2dd78fb2c0be7ef7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-saharaclient refs/changes/74/448174/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import oslo_i18n _translators = oslo_i18n.TranslatorFactory(domain='saharaclient') # The primary translation function using the well-known name "_" _ = _translators.primary
deleted_lines: try: import oslo_i18n _translators = oslo_i18n.TranslatorFactory(domain='saharaclient') # The primary translation function using the well-known name "_" _ = _translators.primary # Translators for log levels. # # The abbreviated names are meant to reflect the usual use of a short # name like '_'. The "L" is for "log" and the other letter comes from # the level. _LI = _translators.log_info _LW = _translators.log_warning _LE = _translators.log_error _LC = _translators.log_critical except ImportError: _ = _LI = _LW = _LE = _LC = lambda x: x

commit_message:
use neutron-lib constants rather than plugin constants

A number of constants that are defined in
neutron.plugins.common.constants are now available in neutron-lib. This
patch switches the reference to use the lib version.

Change-Id: I203c86c26b54b3b9e15cf493b51496ef698284cb

deleted_lines: from neutron.plugins.common import constants as p_constants

commit_message:
Release notes for asynchronous job management API

1. What is the problem
Asynchronous job management APIs are implemented and
under testing[1], we can add release notes for them
at the same time.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Add release notes for asynchronous job management API.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution
None.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/446837

Change-Id: Id42ffa3eaba4de4c9a4ad96cc4cf45399c6c85d7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/68/459668/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Asynchronous job management API allows administrator to perform CRUD operations on a job. For jobs in job log, only list and show operations are permitted. * Create a job * List jobs * Show single job details * Delete a job * Redo a job

commit_message:
monasca-persister: Rotate logs

Add config for logrotate. Otherwise the disk might run out of space.

Change-Id: I937284715d2423799209278befb6278de6c96236
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/88/461988/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /var/log/monasca-persister/*.log { weekly dateext rotate 10 size 1M missingok compress notifempty su monasca-persister monasca minsize 100k }
